New Records: Willy Adames tied the major league record with his 13th three-run homer of the season.
Adames homered for the fifth consecutive game, matching the Brewers record shared by Jeromy Burnitz (1997) and Eric Thames (2017).
Adames’ 13 three-run homers equaled Ken Griffey Jr. in 1996.
Key Match Events: Willy Adames hit his 29th home run of the season, a three-run homer, in the first inning.
Rookie Jackson Chourio hit a grand slam in the sixth inning.
Rhys Hoskins hit a two-run homer in the fourth inning.
Pedro Pagés hit a pair of solo home runs off Freddy Peralta.
Post-Match Reflections: Willy Adames expressed emotional pride in achieving his record on his 29th birthday.
Milwaukee manager Pat Murphy commented on Adames' consistent performance.
Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol reflected on Andre Pallante's performance, acknowledging his recent good stretch despite the current outing.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee hit a two-run homer, three-run homer, and grand slam in the same game for the first time since July 1, 2022.
Cardinals OF Michael Siani returned to the lineup after missing nearly a month with a strained right oblique.
Others: The game lasted 2 hours and 55 minutes.
Umpires for the game were Alfonso Marquez (Home Plate), Lance Barrett (First Base), Jeremy Riggs (Second Base), and Mark Ripperger (Third Base).
